description.raw:
Issue [#2286](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2286/inertial-properties-for-static-models) notes that the left pane displays default link mass and inertial values for static models, which can be confusing to people because static models do not use the inertia values.

Commit 232e1f2 changes the Link::Load method to give links in static models mass and inertia values of 0.0 instead of the defaults. The intention is to make it clearer that the inertia values are not used in static models. I zeroed the inertia values instead of not displaying them because the current GUI logic zeros mass and inertia values if they are missing (ModelListWidget::FillPropertyTree) and because zeroing hides the inertia box visualizations for static models without needing additional logic/changes.

While testing the above change, I noticed that inertia boxes are actually displayed for models with invalid inertia matrices, such as static models. The boxes are just made small so that they are difficult to see. It seems cleaner to not show such inertia boxes at all, so I changed the behavior in aa2c47f.

Before changes
![before.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/kMkRAxo/images/1987339751-before.png)

After changes
![after.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/kMkRAxo/images/1801113156-after.png)

While testing the above change, I noticed that inertia boxes are actually displayed for models with invalid inertia matrices, such as static models. title: Inertia for static models
